result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashawn E. Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Gumz did speak with the defendant yesterday.  It is Atty Hendee's understanding that the Public Defender's office will not appoint another Attorney.  Court did receive the defendant's motion to withdraw his plea.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Defendant states that he wrote a letter but Atty Gumz has not had a chance to look at that yet.
Defendant wants to proceed on his own today.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Defendant states that it is all in his letter that he wrote the court.  Atty Hendee objects to the motion and states reason why.
Defendant makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the defendant's motion.
Motion hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant before court, he was wanting the PD office to appoint counsel.  Atty Hendee asks for a reset to tomorrow morning to deal with the motion with Judge Bult.
Court advised the defendant that he was not the Judge that took the plea.  
BY THE COURT:  Reset to tomorrow morning at 9:00am  Motion hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion to withdraw his plea.  Court received the letter from April 6, 2016; Atty Frank noted that he would not be available today.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant states that it depends on how today went and then he would decide about counsel.  Defendant would like to get PD.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Motion to allow the defendant to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank states that the defendant would like to resolve the case today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Atty Frank asks for a brief recess to discuss with his client.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

BACK ON THE RECORD:
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee clarifies with the court regarding the sentence request.
Atty Frank agrees with that sentence.  Defendant understands the sentence.
Atty Frank asks the court to follow the recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail with conditions:
Sentence to commence forthwith
May serve in Milwaukee County
Credit = 78 days
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May

Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in

with conditions:
*Allow contact by phone only with Gabrielle Miles while he is in custody.  If probation imposes a no contact order, there will be absolutely no contact.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Lashawn E. Gates. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee filed a motion to modify the cash bond to a signature bond with the same conditions.  Atty Frank received the motion and is opposing the motion.
Atty Frank makes arguments and asks the cash bond to remain.
Atty Hendee states that the revocation of extended supervision is in process and his office was contacted by the Agent to allow the defendant to go back to Milwaukee County.

BY THE COURT:  Court will grant the State's motion; cash bond will be converted to a signature bond with the same conditions.
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Modify Bond filed by D.A.
to modify bond filed by D.A.
Bail/bond hearing on March 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
*2/12/16:  Modified to allow phone contact with Gabrielle Miles while defendant is in custody; however, if agent orders no contact provision, there is to be no contact.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions Ms. Gabrielle Miles as to her waiver of the no contact provision.  Ms. Miles assures the Court she wishes to have the provision lifted.  She understands her risks.  Has spoken with the victim witness coordinator and with Hope House.  Atty Hendee makes statement.  States defendant has not posted bond and is currently on a probation hold (and believes probation will be revoked on Extended Supervision).  Has no objection to phone contact while defendant was in custody but if released, does not believe there should be contact.  Believes the probation agent will be requesting no contact.
BY THE COURT:  Court modifies the bond to allow contact by phone only while he is in custody.  If probation imposes a no contact order, there will be absolutely no contact.

Defendant Lashawn E. Gates in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause and enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  
Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement.    BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant would like to speak with an attorney.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
